title: Perth Scorchers Claim Incredible Sixth Big Bash Title | 10 News
description: The Sydney Sixers have returned home without the Big Bash trophy skittled for just 133 runs in Perth against old rivals the Scorchers.  The home side making history with a sixth title in front of a record crowd. title: Australia Day Chaos, Record-Breaking Heatwave Hits Three States, Australia's Piano Man | 10 News+
description: Thousands of people have hit the streets to either celebrate or protest this Australia Day, as it seems the country is becoming increasingly divided.  A historic heatwave has forced several Australia Day events to be cancelled, prompting extreme warnings as temperature records tumble across the country.   He’s known for playing his 350-kilogram baby grand piano in some of the most iconic places across Tasmania, but now he has a new goal — to travel 15,000km across Australia within 45 days with his son. title: Record-Breaking Heat Across Australia Leads To Dangerous Bushfires | 10 News
description: Records are tumbling and we are being warned the heatwave impacting Victoria, South Australia and parts of New South Wales will only worsen tomorrow, with some inland areas expected to near 50 degrees. Those extreme temperatures are expected to worsen conditions for already out-of-control bushfires. title: Trump Meets With Walz Over Minnesota ICE Shooting Fallout | 10 News
description: The White House says US President Donald Trump does not want to see people getting hurt or killed on his country's streets, calling the killing of Minnesota man Alex Pretti by federal immigration agents a "tragedy".  White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt confirmed Trump and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, in an effort to bring an end to the "chaos" in Walz's state following the shooting of Pretti, and previous shooting of resident Renee Goode by ICE agents.  Leavitt also defended the Trump administration's stance on the Second Amendment, cautioning Americans that the right to bear arms does not extend to obstructing law enforcement. title: Volkanovski Shuts Down Retirement Rumours
description: "I am 37 years old, but I ain't your normal 37-year-old."  Alex Volkanovski has called out rumours surrounding his retirement following UFC 325.  The Australian fighter has previously hosed off speculation of an impending retirement following his impending title defence on home turf, but the current UFC Featherweight Champion today went a step further.  Volk said that despite his relative advanced age, he still feels like he has what it takes to be among the best.  "I work harder than these guys, like, even now, at 37 years old," Volkanovski told 10 Sport's Brooke East.  "I'm in good form, and I'll show that this weekend, and, yeah, again, a lot of people are saying, you know, there's going to be retirement. I'll shut them rumours down by, putting on a good performance and calling out whoever it is."  Watch the Prelims for UFC 325 LIVE & FREE on 10 this Sunday. title: Netanyahu Announces Return Of Last Israeli Hostage Ran Gvili’s Body From Gaza | 10 News
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu says the remains of the last Israeli hostage held in Gaza, police officer Ran Gvili, have been found and identified.  The 24-year-old was killed during the October 7, 2023 attacks and his body was taken into Gaza, where it remained for nearly two and a half years.  The IDF recovered his remains following a search operation in eastern Gaza City, with identification confirmed through dental records.  Netanyahu called the recovery an “incredible achievement”, saying Israel had fulfilled its pledge to return all hostages, living and dead.  Hamas says it helped provide intelligence on the location but faced difficulties recovering the body due to Israeli-controlled areas and ongoing military operations.  With no hostages now held in Gaza, Israel says it will move to reopen the Rafah Crossing under agreed conditions with the United States.
